name: Sensational Chicken Noodle Soup
description: Sometimes you just want a good, old-fashioned chicken noodle soup...no fancy ingredients...just great flavor.  Give this version a try...all you need is 6 ingredients and 35 minutes to make a home-style soup that you'll really enjoy.
recipeIngredient: 4 cups Swanson® Chicken Broth or Swanson® Certified Organic Chicken Broth or Swanson® Natural Goodness® Chicken Broth
½ cup uncooked medium egg noodles
1 cup shredded cooked chicken or turkey

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the broth, 1 generous dash ground black pepper, carrot and celery in a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat to a boil.
Stir the noodles and chicken in the saucepan. Reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes or until the noodles are tender, stirring occasionally.

review.reviewBody: this recipe rocks!! I alredy my it 12 times this month!! I also added

Having a hubby on the couch with a cold, I looked this up.  It was a good start.   I like how I enhanced it: two chicken breasts, which I simmered in about 5 c. water for a half-hour.  Removing them to dice them up, I added about 1 T of minced garlic, a few handfulls of angelhair pasta, a few large pinches of dried parsley, and a few large pinches of oregano. I added the recommended Mrs. Dash's, which gave it a lot more zip. I also grated some mini-carrots (about 8), and let them simmer with the broth for about 10 min., before I added the diced-up chicken.  Salt and pepper to taste.  It was really yummy, and became 5-star!

Quick soup. I did add some chopped onion and fresh minced garlic as well as a bay leaf, fresh ground pepper and chopped parsley. Good for using leftover chicken. I'd make this again when I need chicken noodle soup in a hurry.

I loved this recipe! My husband myself and our daughter ate it all in one meal! I also used an extra 4cups of broth as suggested. I added to it gralic powder oregano and chopped onion. The amount of onion really depends on your own tastes. I used a whole chopped onion. Will definately use this recipe again and again!

This is such an awesome quick and easy soup. I added some onion an sauteed all of my veggies in a little butter to start, then added the broth an brought to a boil. I used leftover turkey for the meat, an bow tie pasta since that is what I had on hand, 1/2 cup did not seem like enough so I bumped to 1 cup. I seasoned with a little salt & lots of pepper also added some fresh flat leaf parsley since I had some. OH! I did add two 1/4 teaspoons of garlic powder since I didn't have any garlic cloves. 1/4 tsp of garlic powder is the equivalent to one garlic clove. Just thought I would throw that little tip out there. This soup is a must try. I will be making this again and next time I think I will even add in some frozen green peas.

Taken as soon as it was finished cooking. Turned out fan-tastic. I added 2-cups of Peaches & Cream corn and some fresh chopped garlic. In addition to the garlix and corn I also added an extra 4-cups of Chicken Broth to ensure "soup" consistency. Used large egg noodles and felt that if I hadn't added the extra 4-cups would have been more of a chicken noodle stew. Will definitely make this again. Is already a hit with the family.
good soup! I used one big ckn breast and boiled it and shredded it. Added salt to the water and garlic powder to the broth. Great quick and easy!!!
It was Ok Adding Bit Of Garlic Onion And Cayenne Pepper Helped. also I was shocked that there was no herbs in this soup.

Yummy! I cooked a whole chicken in the pressure cooker for about 20 minutes and used that broth in the soup... wow how great! It was the first time I'd ever made homemade chicken noodle soup and I was totally amazed that it came out so well! Yummy! Thanks!
